c:complexType.name: PieChartOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Pie chart.

c:property.name: pie
c:property.c:documentation: The pie plot is the main plot of the pie chart, which means that its properties may be used without the "pie" property suffix.

c:property.name: visualRoles
c:property.c:documentation: The visual roles that of the pie chart type.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the plot.

c:complexType.name: PieChartExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the pie chart type.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
extension property (ex: smallBase)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: smallBase_strokeStyle (see ).

c:complexType.name: PieVisualRoles
c:complexType.c:documentation: The visual roles of the pie chart type.

c:property.name: category
c:property.c:documentation:
The category visual role represents a slice of the pie.
The category visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the category prefix.
The visual role itself is optional, yet, when unbound, a dimension with a "category" prefix is automatically created for it, and all datums will have the value null in that dimension.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: color
c:property.c:documentation:
The color visual role controls the color of pie slices.
The color visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the color prefix or, if none exists, the dimensions of the "category" role.
The color visual role is discrete.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: value
c:property.c:documentation:
The value visual role controls the relative angle span of each pie slice.
The value visual role automatically binds to a single dimension whose name has the value prefix.
The value visual role is required.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:complexType.name: PiePlotOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of the Pie plot.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for various visual elements of the chart.

c:complexType.name: PiePlotExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the pie plot type.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
plot property name (ex: pie)
extension property (ex: slice)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: pieSlice_strokeStyle (see ).
The extension points of the main plot of a chart may be used without the plot property name prefix. In the example, when the pie plot is the main plot, the extension point can be written as slice_strokeStyle.

c:property.name: slice
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the pie slice - the wedge mark.

c:property.name: label
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the value label mark.

c:property.name: linkLine
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the line mark that links the pie slices and the linked labels.
